item.title: [BOOKKEEPER-345] Detect IOExceptions on entrylogger and bookie should consider next ledger dir(if any)
item.description:
This jira to detect IOExceptions in "EntryLogger", and will iterate over all the configured ledger(s) on IOException. Finally if no writable dirs available, will move bookie to r-o mode(if this mode is enabled).

By default(r-o mode will be disabled) the bookie will shutdown if no writable disk available.
item.summary: Detect IOExceptions on entrylogger and bookie should consider next ledger dir(if any)

Following changes I have done regarding this jira.

  • On addEntry failure
    • Checking the disk full. If current disk is full, then moving to next disk and create another entry log and add entry again.
  • On Flush failure of entry log,
    • Keep all the entries in a list till the flush is called.
    • On successfull flush clear the list
    • On flush failure, create new entry log and re-add all entries.

I will create a patch and upload in some time.

  4. Utility to check for the disk problems.

Vinayakumar B I've taken a look at the patch. Generally the change is good, but there's one architectural issue I'd like you to sort out (the coupling). Also, when you put up a new patch could you mark it as patch available. It makes it easier to see which patchs are ready for review.

In Bookie#shutdown() When catching interrupted exception you should interrupt the current thread.

getAllLegderDirs -> typo, should be getAllLedgerDirs

comment on triggerBookieShutdown isn't clear. You should state that it needs to be in it's own thread, because it can be called from the sync thread, which would be interrupted by this call.

isReadonly() -> typo, should be isReadOnly()

myNode is will always be the same as zkBookieRegPath. zkBookieRegPath is a better name, so make it a final member field of Bookie, and create it in the constructor instead of in registerBookie.

Use an AtomicBoolean for readonly. Rename readonly to readOnly;

I don't like the fact that bookie is passed to LedgerDirsManager. It creates too much coupling between the two, which we already see in BookieShell, when you have pass a null parameter. It would be better to define an interface, DiskFailureListener such as ...

interface DiskFailureListener {
  void diskFailed(File disk);
  void diskFull(File disk);
  void fatalError();
}

LedgerDirsManager should maintain a list of this listeners, and trigger them on a disk failure. Bookie would register a listener with the LedgerDirsManager. When triggered it could then call transitionToReadOnly.

LedgerDirsManager#addToFilledDirs should be private

I think LedgerDirsManager#getFilledDir would be better as LedgerDirsManaager#isDirFull(File dir)

getDiskChecker should be private

LedgerDirsManager#shouldCreateNewEntryLog and LedgerDirsManager#setRelocateIndexFile are state that belong to the EntryLogger & LedgerCache respectively. They shouldn't be in the LedgerDirsManager. Again, it's coupling. These can be implemented by having EntryLogger and LedgerCache register listeners.

Why not put NoWritableLedgerDirException in BookieException?

BookieServer#getBookie() why not add the @VisibleForTesting annotation from guava, since we're using guava now.

DiskChecker#mkdirsWithExistsChecks should be private. Also static. Also, what happens if a crash happens half away through creating /foo/bar/boo? /foo/bar will exist, so no future call to mkdirsWithExistsChecks will succeed.

DiskChecker#setDiskSpaceThreshold and getDiskSpaceThreshold should be marked as @visibleForTesting. Also, they should be package private.
